intro: Joosia frondosa, commonly known as the fronded joosia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Joosia frondosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and sometimes ornamental plant in its native habitat.
